intro: Phyllostegia helleri var. imminuta, commonly known as the narrow-leaf false mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of pink to purple flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant typically grows in moist, sunny habitats such as streambanks and woodland edges. Its botanical features include hairy stems and stipules that are often mistaken for leaves. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton.
